page.title: 07Helping on my farm-by Toby.
page.content:
I get up at 7.30am and get the cows into the shed where we milk them.I turn the milking machines on and put them on the cows for Dad. Then I go and get some milk for Mum.Sometimes Dad lets a girl called Linda do the milking.I feed the calf-cows and then have breakfast.After,I cycle to one of our fields to help with the baling.At 1.30pm.Mum brings us lunch.By now we have 422 bales.At 3.30 we have to stop to get more string.Finally,at 6.00pm. with 870 bales,we go back to do the evening milking.We have tea at 7.45.I go to bed at 8.30pm.It's a hard but enjoyable life on the farm.
by-Toby Eckley-age 9.
